awd_titl_txt: REU Site:  Summer Institute on Human-Computer Interaction
awd_abstract_narration: This project will bring ten students to the University of                  Nebraska-Lincoln for a two month period in the summer of 1993 to                work in the Computer Science Department in the area of human-                   computer interaction.  The opportunity to complete the project will             be available during the academic year.  Components of the project               are introductory readings and lectures to motivate the students in              the area, a seminar to familiarize them with the background for                 their research, an interface prototyping project, a research                    project in which small groups of participants work together to                  choose a research question and instrument an experiment to study                it, and an optional academic year follow-up.  The project will also             include an ethics component that will address three areas; what                 constitutes ethical personal behavior in research, social                       responsibility in scientific research, and ethical standards for                the treatment of human subjects.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
